title: As a federation user I want to see a countdown until the end of the registration period
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=new_player

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a user is viewing the site in English there is a "Registration Time Remaining" box in the top left of the top navigation bar, per the wireframe. 
* The time remaining is calculated based on the current date/time (NOT time zone specific - should be using server time for this) and the Registration Period End date as defined in system dates. 
* When a user is viewing the site in Spanish the text is appropriately translated (see comments).

title: As a federation user I want to be able to sign in to the Federation Registration site
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=federation_login
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=new_player

Acceptance Criteria: 
* A user is able to enter a valid username and password on the Federation Registration site and click "Login". 
* The system will verify the user's credentials, and assuming they are valid, will log the user into the site and take them to the homepage. 
* This story will need to include the UI as well as whatever setup is needed to establish username/passwords that allow entry to the federation registration site. 

*All functionality, the registration deadline working properly, Register a Player form, and any navigation is not covered in this story*

title: As a BOC user I want to set the maximum number of players each federation is allowed to register
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=federation_registration_admin

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+Registration+Admin+Widget+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Users are able to click "Edit" and have the form page reload in edit mode.  
* Users are able to enter a numeric value in the Registration Limit field for each Organization (do not allow entry of letters or characters). 
* Clicking "Save" will run a required field check - if the required field check passes then the system will display a successful save notification and reload the form in view mode.  
* "Cancel" is also available while in Edit mode. Clicking Cancel will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes - if they confirm the form is reloaded in view mode with no changes stored. 


*The user id test_ebis_user52@mlb.com should already be set up with the necessary permissions to test this.*

title: As a federation user I want to be able to choose whether to view the homepage in English or Spanish
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=new_player

Acceptance Criteria: 
* After logging into the system, there is an "English" and an "EspaÃ±ol" hyperlink at the top of the page, see wireframe for location. 
* The language currently being used is greyed out and not clickable.
* When viewing the site in English, clicking on "EspaÃ±ol" will reload the page in Spanish. The system will need to maintain this selection as the user navigates from tab to tab and form to form. 
* When viewing the site in Spanish, clicking on "English" will reload the page in English. The system will need to maintain this selection as the user navigates from tab to tab and form to form. 

Tab names in Spanish: 
 - Nuevo Jugador
 - Consentimiento
 - Ayuda

title: As a federation user I want to be able to Sign Out of the system
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=new_player

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Sign Out" link at the top right corner of the page per the wireframe. 
* If viewing the page in Spanish this says "Finalizar Sesiá½¹n", in English it says "Sign Out". 
* Clicking "Sign Out" or "Finalizar Sesiá½¹n"  will log the user out of the winter league portal, and take them back to the login page.

custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=registration_application

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Form+%28External+Org%29+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a federation user loads a profile from search, it follows the provided wireframe and data discovery.
* Browser tab text says "Last, First"
* Federation users are not permitted to see any other Orgs' Contact Information or Attached Files, and no toggles display to allow them to view other Orgs' information. 
* Users see a "Close" button in view mode that will always take them to the homepage (New Player).

The browser tab text should say "Ayuda"

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Next" on the new player screen should verify that the player being entered is at least 14 years of age based on the current date and the entered DOB. If the player is not yet 14 years old, display error Message #9.

* This feature works exactly the same in English in Spanish, except in Spanish the hint text in the box is "Buscar Jugadores"

title: As a BOC user I want to view the External Registration Admin screen
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=federation_registration_admin

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+Registration+Admin+Widget+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Users who have the EBIS WIDGET INTERNATIONAL EXTN REG ADMIN EDITORS permission (within the "INTL BOC Reg Admin" role) are able to see a "External Reg" tab on the International dashboard. 
* If the user does not have both of these permissions, they do not see this tab.
* The tab and subnav link appear in alpha order
* The browser tab text says "External Reg"
* Loading the tab should display the External Registration page per the provided data discovery and wireframe.
* The default signing period to display is the upcoming one (based on whether we are before or after August 31st). 
  - "Upcoming" signing period in the context of international amateur always means the next signing period - so right now the upcoming signing period is 2018-2019, but after this August 31st the "current" signing period will be 2019-2020. 
* A line item appears for each external organization currently available in the system. 
* The number of players that have been registered for the relevant signing period by the corresponding federation displays on the screen.

title: As a federation user I want to be able to view which Consent Forms are available for Download in English
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=consent_forms

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Consent+Form+Widget+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking on the "Consent Forms" top navigation link will take the user to a Consent Forms page. 
* The Consent Forms widget will display per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
* The browser tab text will say "Consent Forms"
* Only system forms that are marked as being available for External Registration AND are currently marked as active are displayed. (the management of these forms was built by NL and should be fully in place)
* System forms that are marked as Inactive or are not flagged as meant to display for External Registration users do not display. 
* Changing the header filter to another language should filter the the widget appropriately.
* Clicking on the paperclip icon of any row should download the appropriate form to the user's computer.

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Entering invalid credentials (an invalid username or password)  and clicking Log In should trigger an error message. 
Login failed. Please enter a valid user ID and password

title: As a user I want to see an error message if I enter invalid credentials on the federation registration login page
custom_steps:
Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+Registration+Application+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Entering invalid credentials (for a user that does not have the proper fed-reg user permission) and clicking Log In should trigger an error message. See Messages #11.

title: As a federation user I want to see a the number of players that my Organization has registered during the current registration period
custom_steps:
Wire:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=new_player

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a user is viewing the site in English there is a "xx/xxx players registered" text at the top of the New Player form per the wireframe (the verbiage is different than wire - use what is in the story, please). 
* The first number is the current number of profiles that have been registered during the current registration period by the viewing Org. 
* The second number is the current limit set for the viewing Org by the BOC in the external registration admin screen.  
* When a user is viewing the site in Spanish the text is appropriately translated to say 'jugadores registrados' in place of players registered.

title: As a federation user I want to see an error if my Organization has attempted to register too many players (English)
custom_steps:
Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+%28Federation%29+Registration+Application

Messages #2: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+Registration+Application+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Next" on the new player screen should verify that the entering Org has not created the maximum amount of players allowed for their Organization for the current registration period. If the Org is at or above their limit, display an error. See Message #2.

title: As a federation user I want to enter Contact Information on a new Registration Profile (English)
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=registration_application

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Form+%28External+Org%29+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When creating a registration profile, the federation user has the ability to add Address information for the player per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
* More than one address set may be used by clicking "Add Address". 
* Additional address sets can be deleted using the trash can icon, but there must always be at least one set of Address fields. 
* When creating a registration profile, the federation user has the ability to add Trainer/Agent/League information for the player per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
* When creating a registration profile, the federation user has the ability to add Email Address information for the player per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
* More than one email address set may be used by clicking "Add Email". 
* Additional email address sets can be deleted using the trash can icon, but there must always be at least one set of email address fields. 
* When creating a registration profile, the federation user has the ability to add Phone information for the player per the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
* More than one phone number set may be used by clicking "Add Number". 
* Additional phone number sets can be deleted using the trash can icon, but there must always be at least one set of phone number fields.

title: As a federation user I want to see a success message when a profile is successfully submitted to the BOC for the first time
custom_steps:
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+Registration+Application+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
* When a registration profile is successfully saved in the Federation registration site for the first time, a successful blocking message is displayed explaining that the player's profile is still subject to additional review. See Messages #4.
* This message is NOT displayed if the user is only updating a Correction Needed profile.

title: As a user I want to save a new Registration Profile (English)
custom_steps:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Form+%28External+Org%29+-+Data+Discovery

Wireframe:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=registration_application

Date Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Requirement

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When creating a new Registration profile, there is a "Save" button available as well as a "Cancel" button.
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel. If they confirm, the user is returned to the point of entry and no profile is stored. If they do not confirm, they are returned to the profile in edit mode. 
* If the user clicks "Save", then the system runs a required field and formatting check per the provided data discovery, saves the profile and a blue successful save notification is thrown. 
* Errors should be handled the same way as EBIS, highlighted missed fields, error modal, pinned errors.  
* Fields are conditionally required, especially upload labels, so the data discovery should be paid special attention. 
* The Registration status should be set to "Pending BOC Review" on save.
* The player's Eligible to Sign Date should be correctly set per the rules.
* The player's Meets Age Requirement Date should be correctly set per the rules.

title: As a user I want the language of the site to default based on my last visit, if applicable
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* The federation registration site should be able to detect if the visiting user has visited the site before and their language preferences. 
* If a user is visiting the site for the first time, or has cleared their cache/cookies since their last visit, then it will simply default to English.

Messages #9:

title: As a federation user I want the system to recognize what Organization I am affiliated with
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=federation_login
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=new_player

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There are currently 2 Federations that are being used - Australia and Mexico. 
* The system needs some way to associate the federation users with the correct Organization. 
* These Orgs should not appear anywhere in ebis outside of International Amateur. 
* We need the flexibility to be able to add additional Orgs in the future. 
* Part of delivering this story should be delivering 2 user ids - one for MEX and one for AUS that can be used for testing.

title: As a federation user I want to see an error if I attempt to enter a player while the registration period is closed (English)
custom_steps:
Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+%28Federation%29+Registration+Application

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+Registration+Application+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a system date for each year that is the "registration cut off date".  It is composed of a date and time component.  (Registration Period end date/time on the system dates screen)
* After the specified date and time, but BEFORE the start of the following Registration period, clicking "Next" from the Create New player screen should display an error. See Messages #7.

title: As a federation user I want to edit an existing Registration Profile (English)
custom_steps:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Form+%28External+Org%29+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a federation registration user is viewing a Registration Profile in View mode that has a Registration Status of Correction Needed (there are 3 separate correction needed statuses), there is an Edit button. 
* The federation users do not see an edit button if the Registration Status is set to anything else. 
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the profile in edit mode but ONLY the attached files section should be editable for these users. 
* There will be a "Submit" and a "Cancel" button available in edit mode. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose any unsaved changes. If they confirm, the system will reload the profile in View mode, with no changes made. 
* Clicking "Submit" will run a required field and formatting check. Assuming the required field and format check passes, the system will reload the profile in View mode, with the changes stored and visible.
* The player's registration status should be updated to "Resubmitted to BOC".

Acceptance Criteria:

* After the specified date and time, but BEFORE the start of the following Registration period, clicking "Siguiente" from the Create New player screen should display an error. See Messages #7.

custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=registration_application

* This story covers ALL sections of the profile. 
* Federation users are not permitted to see any other Orgs' Contact Information or Attached Files, and no toggles display to allow them to view other Orgs' information.

title: As a federation user I want to edit an existing Registration Profile (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Form+%28External+Org%29+-+Data+Discovery

Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+Registration+Application+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a federation registration user is viewing a Registration Profile in View mode that has a Registration Status of Correction Needed (there are 3 separate correction needed statuses), there is an Editar button. 
* The federation users do not see an edit button if the Registration Status is set to anything else. 
* Clicking "Editar" will reload the profile in edit mode but ONLY the attached files section should be editable for these users. 
* There will be a "Enviar" and a "Cancelar" button available in edit mode. 
* Clicking "Cancelar" will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose any unsaved changes. If they confirm, the system will reload the profile in View mode, with no changes made. 
* Clicking "Enviar" will run a required field and formatting check. Assuming the required field and format check passes, the system will reload the profile in View mode, with the changes stored and visible.
* The player's registration status should be updated to "Resubmitted to BOC".

title: As a federation user I want to see a success message when a profile is successfully submitted to the BOC for the first time (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+Registration+Application+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
* When a registration profile is successfully saved in the Federation registration site for the first time, if the user is working Spanish then the successful blocking message is displayed in Spanish. See Messages #4.
* This message is NOT displayed if the user is only updating a Correction Needed profile.

title: As a player I want to receive an email when my registration profile created by a federation user is moved to Correction Needed (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Template:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Email+to+Federation+Entered+Player+when+Marked+as+Correction+Needed+-+Spanish

Placeholders: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Template+Placeholders

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Registration profile that was entered by a federation user is moved to a Correction Needed status, the primary email address on the player profile receives an email. See provided template.
* If the player's home country is one of the following countries, the email text will include the Spanish version first followed by the English version:
  - Dominican Republic
  - Venezuela
  - Panama 
  - Colombia
  - Mexico  
  - Nicaragua
  - Argentina 
  - Spain 
  - Costa Rica 
  - Ecuador  
  - El Salvador
  - Guatemala
  - Honduras
  - Peru
* If the player's home country is any other country then the email is only in English.

title: As a federation user I want to create a new Registration Profile with the required National ID information
custom_steps:
Country Listing: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Country+Listing

Acceptance Criteria: 
*Note that some of the validation checks here ARE different from what is in the DB so this will need to be reviewed and is intentional*

* When entering a player on the Create New, the National ID country is prepopulated based on the country selected for the Country of Residence (just like Birth Country). 
* The "National ID Type" field is ONLY displayed if there is more than one type available (currently only true for US and its territories). 
* If the National ID has a validation check, the required format is displayed as help text in the National ID field. 
* If the National ID has a validation check and a national ID is entered, hitting "Next" from the Create New will verify that the National ID entered matches the required format. 
* If the National ID is required based on the entered BIRTH country a red * will be visible.
* If the National ID is required based on the entered BIRTH country, and no National ID value is entered, then "Next" will remain disabled. 
* The National ID fields will prepopulate on the profile whatever was entered on the Create New. 
* The user will have the ability to enter multiple national IDs for a player by clicking 'Add ID', and be able to remove additional sets using the trash can icon. At least one National ID fieldset must be present at all times. 
* The same validation and required field checks run on the Create New will also be run anytime the profile is Saved. 
* If there is no National ID required and one is NOT entered, then in view mode - no National ID fields will display. (even though National ID country is selected).
* If a national ID has been entered, it displays in view mode like it does now for Pro Player Profiles, with the Country subheading and using the "Display" value from the Country Listing document. (see comment for example)

title: As a federation user I want to create a new Registration Profile (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=registration_application

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Form+%28External+Org%29+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* On the homepage there is a "New Player" form available, per the wireframe. 
* The "Next" button is disabled until all of the required fields have been entered.  
* Entering the required fields on the Create New form, including a DOB on or after 9/1/1995 will take the user to a new registration profile, per the data discovery and wireframe. 
* There are a lot of conditionally displayed fields on these profiles, so the data discovery should be paid special attention.  This story covers the entire profile. 
* Any action buttons are handled in follow up stories.

title: As a federation user I want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches a profile I have already entered (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+Registration+Application+-+Messages

Wireframe:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=potential_matches

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Siguiente" on the Create New will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
* These users ONLY see matches to players that they have entered. 
* If a match is found to a player the user has permission to see, then the user gets a warning. See Messages #3.
* Clicking "Continue" will proceed with profile creation. 
* Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again.

title: As a federation user I only want to see players in Quick Search that I have permission to see
custom_steps:
Quicksearch Population: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Quick+Search+Population+rules

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+%28Federation%29+Registration+Application

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a federation user is searching for players, only Registration profiles that have been registered by the user's Organization are returned. (Do not necessarily to be the first registering Org).

title: As a federation user I want to receive an email when a registration profile my Org has entered is moved to Correction Needed (English)
custom_steps:
Template:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Email+sent+to+Federation+when+Player+Marked+as+Correction+Needed

Placeholders: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Template+Placeholders

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Registration profile that was entered by a federation user is moved to a Correction Needed status, the registering user receives an email. See provided template.

title: As a BOC user I want to see an error if I attempt to lower the allowable limit for an organization below the number they have already registered
custom_steps:
Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+Registration+Application+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When the user clicks "Save", verify that no value entered by the BOC is lower than the number of players that the corresponding federation has already registered for the associated signing period. 
* If any of the values entered are lower than that already registered, display an error. See Messages #6

title: As a player I want to receive an email when my registration profile created by a federation user is moved to Correction Needed (English)
custom_steps:
Template:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Email+to+Federation+Entered+Player+when+Marked+as+Correction+Needed+-+English

Placeholders: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Template+Placeholders

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Registration profile that was entered by a federation user is moved to a Correction Needed status, the primary email address on the player profile receives an email. See provided template.

title: As a federation user I want to receive an email when a registration profile my Org has entered is moved to Correction Needed (Spanish)
custom_steps:
Template:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Email+sent+to+Federation+when+Player+Marked+as+Correction+Needed+-+Spanish

Placeholders: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Template+Placeholders

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Registration profile that was entered by a federation user is moved to a Correction Needed status, the registering user receives an email. See provided template.
* If the player's home country is one of the following countries, the email text will include the Spanish version first followed by the English version:
  - Dominican Republic
  - Venezuela
  - Panama 
  - Colombia
  - Mexico  
  - Nicaragua
  - Argentina 
  - Spain 
  - Costa Rica 
  - Ecuador  
  - El Salvador
  - Guatemala
  - Honduras
  - Peru
* If the player's home country is any other country then the email is only in English.

title: As a federation user I want to create a new Registration Profile (English)
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=new_player

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Form+%28External+Org%29+-+Data+Discovery

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Requirement

Acceptance Criteria: 
* On the homepage there is a "New Player" form available, per the wireframe. 
* The "Next" button is disabled until all of the required fields have been entered.  
* Entering the required fields on the Create New form, including a DOB on or after 9/1/1995 will take the user to a new registration profile, per the data discovery and wireframe. 
* There are a lot of conditionally displayed fields on these profiles, so the data discovery should be paid special attention.  
* Contact Information, Attached Files and National ID sections are covered in subsequent stories. 
* Any action buttons are handled in follow up stories.
* The player's Eligible to Sign date and Meets Age Requirements dates should be appropriately calculated and displayed on the new profile.

title: As a federation user I want to add Attached Files to a new Registration Profile (English)
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=registration_application

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Form+%28External+Org%29+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When creating a registration profile, the federation user has the ability to add Attached Files to the profile.
* The file attachment section should follow the provided wireframe and data discovery and follow the ebis standards for Attached Files. 
* The labels available for the attached files should match those provided in the data discovery.
* If a label is required for the player to be registered, the label should show with an asterisk in the dropdown.

title: As a federation user I want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches a profile I have already entered (English)
custom_steps:
Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/External+Registration+Application+-+Messages

Wireframe:
https://1s14jq.axshare.com/#p=potential_matches

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Next" on the Create New will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
* These users ONLY see matches to players that they have entered. 
* If a match is found to an international registration player profile that the user has permission to see, then the user gets a warning. See Messages #3.
* Clicking "Continue" will proceed with profile creation. 
* Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again.
